author: pcaversaccio
content:
sharing here for visibility: I deployed on address https://etherscan.io/address/0x0e04bDF212088405D1EF8abE507F644a87c17a84#readContract a (Vyper-based) historical block hashes oracle leveraging EIP-2935 which goes live in 7 days (until then blocks older than a 256 delta will return zero `bytes32`). So people can start using it immediately when Pectra goes live (takes overall 8,191 blocks (including the fork block number) to fully populate the history). This oracle is deployed in a `CREATE2` approach using my contract factory `CreateX`; so anyone can go and deploy it on other chains once Pectra is also activated there. I have documented all the details here: https://gist.github.com/pcaversaccio/64c7829e0c7ed4eeb1e5a07e2177836c. This is good use case of an EIP that fits into user needs btw.

You can already test it on Sepolia if you want
```
~$ export ETH_RPC_URL=https://ethereum-sepolia.rpc.subquery.network/public
~$ cast call 0x0e04bDF212088405D1EF8abE507F644a87c17a84 "block_hash(uint256)(bytes32)" $(($(cast block-number) - 1337))
```
